title: Todd Young
deleted: Young planned to vote in support of certifying the [[2020 United States presidential election Electoral College count]] on January 6, 2021. Young also said he supported efforts to create a bipartisan "Election Integrity Committee" to review the 2020 presidential election.<ref name="GDN1721">{{cite news |title=Reactions to Washington rioting vary |url=https://www.greensburgdailynews.com/news/local_news/reactions-to-washington-rioting-vary/article_813beed2-5125-11eb-bff7-27b4d79de7f8.html |access-date=9 January 2021 |work=Greensburg Daily News |date=7 January 2021 |language=en}}</ref> While entering the US Capitol to participate in the certification on January 6, 2021, Young was accosted by pro-Trump protestors.<ref name="Edmondson1">{{cite news |last1=Edmondson |first1=Catie |title=Facing Backlash, Republicans Confront Trump’s Effect on Their Party |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/09/us/politics/republican-party-trump.html |access-date=9 January 2021 |work=The New York Times |date=9 January 2021}}</ref> He was questioned as to why he would vote to support the count, claiming voter fraud.<ref name="Edmondson1"/> Young explained that “When it comes to the law, our opinions don’t matter — the law matters."<ref name="Edmondson1"/> The ''[[South Bend Tribune]]'s'' editorial board wrote "Young was right to reject the move that Braun had embraced — but his words should have come two months earlier, not at the last minute. That would have been upholding his duty and fulfilling his oath of office."<ref name="SBTOpin">{{cite news |title=Our Opinion: Too little, too late from Indiana representatives |url=https://www.southbendtribune.com/news/opinion/our_opinion/our-opinion-too-little-too-late-from-indiana-representatives/article_d55a436e-4f6e-11eb-b273-1b8411c340ac.html |access-date=9 January 2021 |work=South Bend Tribune |date=8 January 2021 |language=en}}</ref> He was participating in the count when the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|storming of the Capitol]] happened. Upon the storming, Todd tweeted "This is not a peaceful protest - it is violence and reprehensible. It must stop."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Turner |first1=Brock E. W. |title=Indiana's Congressional Delegation Responds To Insurrection, Defends Elector Approval Votes |url=https://indianapublicmedia.org/news/indianas-congressional-delegation-respond-to-insurrection,-defend-elector-approval-votes.php |access-date=9 January 2021 |work=News - Indiana Public Media |date=7 January 2021}}</ref> Todd voted in support of certifying the count when Congress was able to return to session.<ref name="Edmondson">{{cite news |last1=Edmondson |first1=Catie |title=Facing Backlash, Republicans Confront Trump’s Effect on Their Party |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/09/us/politics/republican-party-trump.html |access-date=9 January 2021 |work=The New York Times |date=9 January 2021}}</ref> In the wake of the attack, Young would not comment on if he supported using the [[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution]] to remove Trump, stating that he trusted the Vice President and Trump cabinet members to "conscientiously and legally carry out their duties until Jan. 20."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Andrea |first1=Lawrence |title=Indiana Rep. André Carson joins call to remove Trump from office |url=https://www.indystar.com/story/news/politics/elections/2021/01/07/indiana-congressional-delegation-responds-requests-remove-trump/6586950002/ |access-date=9 January 2021 |work=The Indianapolis Star |date=8 January 2021}}</ref>
